activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Amie M Miles

records.addlTxt: 1 - Certified copy of bail bond in 21CF245.

9:08 AM Defendant Amie M Miles appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie appeared by video for Amie M Miles.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
9:09 AM Officer Sawyer Prinsen, Patrol Officer of RLPD called, sworn in and questioned by the State.  
9:12 AM Cross examination by Attorney Kaupie.   
Exhibit 1-Certified copy of bond-offered by State and received by Court.
9:15 AM Testimony closed.  No argument by State.  Defense moves to dismiss case. 
Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over. 
Bail to continue.
Arraignment scheduled for December 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:03 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amie M Miles appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for Amie M Miles. Attorney Kaupie relates regarding amended complaint.  Reading waived, time limits for preliminary examination are waived. NOH to be mailed to DE.  Attorney Kaupie relates regarding DE having not signed bond yet.  Court orders DE to sign bond by the end of business today at Clerk of Courts Office.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am before Judge Bitney.

11:08 AM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amie M Miles appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph J. Kaupie appeared by video for Amie M Miles.
Request for Substitution has been filed.  Next hearing may be by zoom before Judge Boyle.  No address or phone number change.  Bond continued.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Warrant quashed. Set before Judge Boyle at 10 AM to see if counsel has been appointed. May appear by zoom.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Amie M Miles not in court.   Attorney Steuer appears by Zoom video for today only.
Court relates on summons for today, and requires proof of service.  State relates summons was returned undeliverable and requests reset of Initial Appearance for personal service.  Court resets.
Initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
